intro: Henriettea glazioviana, commonly known as the Glaziovian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Brazil. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in areas with high altitude and moderate rainfall. Henriettea glazioviana is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
